instruction: Translate the following passage into English.
output: In the midst of the world suffering from double-digit inflation rates, Japan is the exception. In July, inflation was only 2.6%. Due to this low inflation, despite other countries tightening their financial policies, the Bank of Japan has been able to maintain its monetary easing policy. This policy discrepancy has caused a 3.4% gap in the interest rates of 10-year US bonds and Japanese government bonds, resulting in a significant yen depreciation against the dollar, the largest in 24 years (see chart below).
